$interpreted: Wily Merchant: I won't accept it! You can't do this!
Karen: First, selling counterfeit gemstones hurts the reputation of the Chamber of Commerce.
Karen: Second, your actions disregard the customer's safety, putting their lives in harm's way.
Karen: Third, I'm the president of the chamber, so naturally, I have the right to deal with this issue.
Wily Merchant: You...bastard!
Sherlock: What's going on? Isn't he a member of the Chamber?
Karen: Starting today, he's not anymore. He's been poaching the rare Blazetail Lizards, so I've expelled him from the Chamber.
Sherlock: What!? The ones with crystals inside of them that are used to make counterfeit gemstones?
Sherlock: I heard the profit on that is thousands of Curren per stone!!
Karen: A counterfeit gemstone is at risk of exploding if rubbed the wrong way. They've been banned a long time ago.
Wily Merchant: Hey! Just be careful and don't rub it! Before you became president, everybody sold'em.
Wily Merchant: Nobody cared back then! So why should I be condemned by you now?
Sherlock: Hmmm...thousands of Curren... Even I'm a bit interested...
Karen: Then what if such a necklace is worn on the neck of your beloved Lisa?
Karen: As president of the Desert Bazaar Commerce chamber, I order you to leave at once! You are no longer allowed to set up shop in the Bazaar!
Wily Merchant: You filthy demihuman...if not for the lizard scales on your body that earned you some trust from the Lizardmen in the desert,
Wily Merchant: you've got no damn right to serve as president!
Karen: My physical attributes do gain me some favors, but I rely on my abilities to maintain the Bazaar and the relationship between the two nations.
Karen: Unlike you, who flaunts your racial identity and yet is still unable to hide your utter incompetence.
Wily Merchant: You can only grovel in this area between the two nations, you filthy half-lizard freak!
Wily Merchant: Humans hate demihumans and the lizards only trust pure-blood Lizardmen. Once you leave here, there is no place left for you to grovel!
Karen: ...I'll only say it once more. Leave, now.
Karen: What? You want to console me?
Sherlock: Hah! Funny. No, now's just a good time to tell you that I'll be headed to Kingdom of the Sun in a few days.
Sherlock: Thus, I won't be able to attend the chamber meetings.
Karen: ...And what exactly are you going for?
Sherlock: The princess is holding an official coronation ceremony or something like that.
Sherlock: She probably remembered how much I helped her before, so she sent me an invitation to attend. Hehe~
Karen: Just you? You're going alone?
Sherlock: Of course I can bring my family〜I'm sure I'll be commended in front of a huge crowd. Best let Ned and Lisa see how amazing their daddy is~
Sherlock: Only problem, what should I bring for the coronation gift? Hmm...there must be a way for me to not spend any money...
Karen: Unable to fend for themselves...but what other choices do they have? Pitiful creatures...
Bodyguard: So it's you. Is there something you want?
Karen: Since His Majesty arrived in the desert, he has refused to see anyone. I want to make sure of his safety.
Bodyguard: ...Follow me.

Model.Text: I won't accept it! You can't do this!
First, selling counterfeit gemstones hurts the reputation of the Chamber of Commerce.
Second, your actions disregard the customer's safety, putting their lives in harm's way.
Third, I'm the president of the chamber, so naturally, I have the right to deal with this issue.
You...bastard!
What's going on? Isn't he a member of the Chamber?
Starting today, he's not anymore. He's been poaching the rare Blazetail Lizards, so I've expelled him from the Chamber.
What!? The ones with crystals inside of them that are used to make counterfeit gemstones?
I heard the profit on that is thousands of Curren per stone!!
A counterfeit gemstone is at risk of exploding if rubbed the wrong way. They've been banned a long time ago.
Hey! Just be careful and don't rub it! Before you became president, everybody sold'em.
Nobody cared back then! So why should I be condemned by you now?
Hmmm...thousands of Curren... Even I'm a bit interested...
Then what if such a necklace is worn on the neck of your beloved Lisa?
As president of the Desert Bazaar Commerce chamber, I order you to leave at once! You are no longer allowed to set up shop in the Bazaar!
You filthy demihuman...if not for the lizard scales on your body that earned you some trust from the Lizardmen in the desert,
you've got no damn right to serve as president!
My physical attributes do gain me some favors, but I rely on my abilities to maintain the Bazaar and the relationship between the two nations.
Unlike you, who flaunts your racial identity and yet is still unable to hide your utter incompetence.
You can only grovel in this area between the two nations, you filthy half-lizard freak!
Humans hate demihumans and the lizards only trust pure-blood Lizardmen. Once you leave here, there is no place left for you to grovel!
...I'll only say it once more. Leave, now.
What? You want to console me?
Hah! Funny. No, now's just a good time to tell you that I'll be headed to Kingdom of the Sun in a few days.
Thus, I won't be able to attend the chamber meetings.
...And what exactly are you going for?
The princess is holding an official coronation ceremony or something like that.
She probably remembered how much I helped her before, so she sent me an invitation to attend. Hehe~
Just you? You're going alone?
Of course I can bring my family〜I'm sure I'll be commended in front of a huge crowd. Best let Ned and Lisa see how amazing their daddy is~
Only problem, what should I bring for the coronation gift? Hmm...there must be a way for me to not spend any money...
Unable to fend for themselves...but what other choices do they have? Pitiful creatures...
So it's you. Is there something you want?
Since His Majesty arrived in the desert, he has refused to see anyone. I want to make sure of his safety.
...Follow me.
